form.instruction:
You need to make sure the cardinal number words in your lexicon will be mapped to the syntactic category Num (including the same capitalization). Choose one of the following options, depending on your situation:
If you already have numbers marked with the category Num in your lexicon, nothing more needs to be done.
If numbers are mixed in with another category in the lexicon (e.g. adjectives), you either need to give them the category Num in your morphological parser, or add the feature makeNum to each appropriate entry in the lexicon so the category will be changed for the syntax.
If you have numbers marked in your lexicon with a distinct category all their own, but it is different from Num, enter that category below so PAWS can map your morphological category to Num.
Num
You need to make sure the conjunctions in your lexicon will be mapped to the syntactic category Conj. Choose one of the following options, depending on your situation:
If you already have conjunctions marked with the category Conj in your lexicon, nothing more needs to be done.
If conjunctions are mixed in with another category in the lexicon, you either need to give them the category Conj in your morphological parser, or add the feature makeConj to each appropriate entry in the lexicon so the category will be changed for the syntax. (If a particular entry can also be used as another syntactic category, make a separate lexical entry for each use.)
If you have conjunctions marked in your lexicon with a distinct category all their own, but it is different from Conj, enter that category below so PAWS can map your morphological category to Conj.
Conj
